comments.commentBody: I would bet that 2-Down originally had an Arrested Development themed clue, given the author.  That would have made that corner much easier for me!

Moss isn't going back to the Pats. First off, since Moss has been put on waivers, all NFL teams have a chance to sign him--but the worst-record team has the first crack and the best-record team (Patriots) have the last shot.

Secondly, Moss's production has dropped every year since the record-breaking 2007 season. A significant percentage of Brady's interceptions over the past two years were throws intended for Moss. The Pats were moving their offense away from Randy even before he shot his way out of town.

Part of that de-emphasis was because the team wanted to return to its short-pass, West-Coast offense that didn't focus on long-ball receivers like Moss. Part of that change also was due to Randy's declining effectiveness.

Maybe Moss has just fallen into the bad habits of quitting when jammed hard at the line and tuning out of the game when he is not the focus of the offense. Maybe his physical skills are dropping off the table now. But he sure hasn't been much of a receiver this season.

Don't count on Moss teaming up with Bill and Tom again. Thanks for the memories, Randy.

The NY Times recently published an article highlighting supporting Greenberg's claim. In my internet browser the title appears "Yankees Caps Are Popular Among Criminals" (9/15/10). This may be an unfair generalization, yet at the same time I don't see management working to dissuade or distance themselves from such hooligans.

Fox Sports hates San Francisco.  They showed a few reaction shots from Civic Center, but this town is going nuts right now and there was NO WAY Fox was going to show that.  That might make San Francisco seem like the "real America."  There's a crowd outside the ballpark, and I think every fire engine and police car in town blew their sirens when the Giants won.  This town has been going nuts for this team for months, but you'd never know they were anything but batting practice for Texas from the sound of things from Fox.
Come on, all the East Coast fans could use some lessons in civility.  Just too much arrogance and the expectation that you deserve it.  Move over, the Giants are world champions!

"For Greenberg, a Pittsburgh sports lawyer who took over the Rangers in August in tandem with Nolan Ryan, taking a swipe at New York was an easy way to enhance his status in Texas."

Well, with all that winning experience in Pittsburgh and now exactly one trip to the World Series, at which his team was being soundly trounced, it's pretty easy to see why he would prefer to talk about the Yankees.
To all Cubby fans everywhere...........Wait'll next year!
How did I know the sour-grapes Yankees fans would claim this World Series doesn't count? If my team had played like the Yankees did against Texas, I'd be wanting to talk about something else too.

Since New York they chose to uproot
The Giants had been in pursuit
Of World Series titles
But suffered false idols
Until they got pitchers hirsute.

News Short n' Sweet by JFD8
http://twitter.com/JFD8
Hats off to all the loyal NY/east coast fans who've kept their connection with the Giants over the years. It's your celebration, too.
loved the last quote; "it's a competitive market, as it should be, so we'll see what happens." Good one!

Great Yankees sure what a original plan sign every expensive free agent you want , then forcing us all to pay high prices for the one or maybe two games we can afford to take our family too. Until we all wake up and stop supporting this overprice destruction of baseball & all sports this will not end . Pox on all the greedy owners and players. Glad to see Giants win , they did with great pitching and heart. Sadly something the Yankees lack for long time now.
So why are there govt employee unions at all? I give up. Why?
Where are the jobs coming from?

Ok, I get it. All those voting for the Republicans want insurance policies to be rescinded on trump-up charges if the insured gets seriously ill, want people to be denied insurance for pre-existing conditions, want GM to collapse, want the Dow to go back to 6,000, want to return to the government's tacit approval of predatory lending practices and reckless investment by banks, and want a return to 700,000 job losses a month. But why?

Upswing?????
Do not hold your breath. There are major systemic issues that have not disappeared. So far there is barely a recognition of the problems, let alone a serious discussion regarding answers.

comments.userLocation: Lewis Family Farm, Essex, New York
comments.commentBody:
If Voltaire's Pangloss counseled Candide - who guided Matt Bai to this bit of delusional clap trap?

When will The New York Times help its readers to understand what happened here?

Perhaps The New York Times really doesn't get it.
Except we are not going to have a recovery..and things will be like in Japan. Then these new repbulican governors are not going to look that great anymore either.

To those who complain that unions can spend members' money on political campaigns via an opt-out policy: why aren't you complaining that corporations spend the money of their employees and shareholders without EITHER an opt-out or an opt-in policy? Seems extremely hypocritical.

The simple fact is that Presidents and Governors do not create jobs (other than wasteful public sector jobs)or good economies. They can only hurt economies or create limited conditions that permit the private sector to do its job. Virtually all of these politcians take credit (or deny blame) for economic conditions over which they have no control.
Obama could veto everything passed by Republicans for the next two years, so that any good results over that time could be traced to the effects of what Democrats have done over the past two.

Whoever wrote this piece is totally clueless and completely insensitive to what is happening in this country.  The last thing anyone should be thinking about is how "lucky" a politician is to be elected during a financial disaster because if things get better the politicians can take "credit."  This isn't reporting, and the people you are talking to aren't rally sources.  They're just apparatchiks, and you are just a mouthpiece.

I gotta hand it to you, NYT. You guys have some brass. So Clinton's success was due in large part to the policies of... Ronald Reagan? Gotcha. Clinton reigned over a Golden age - a gay 90s - but the mere suggestion he inherited a solid economic foundation was dismissed as the hyperbolic, hateful politics of the ignorant flyover masses.

I don't want to debate Clintonism vs. Reaganism (and apparently neither do you) and it's irrelevant anyway - this is a front page article based on flimsy anecdotal evidence. It's a desperate pseudo-theory without an ounce of credibility, and it's infuriating to me that you would run this the day before an election because I don't think you believe it for a minute. No one does. Personally, I'm looking for someone who will tell me just how bad things might become, and not whisper sweet-nothings in my ear about how the good times are just around the corner and suggest that I should just wait and see.

Also, Nikki Haley is far from an unknown in South Carolina. Just because the chattering classes and "Washington observers" haven't anointed her means nothing to the people of SC. And only you would have the chutzpah to suggest that she or any of the other winners on Tuesday will "benefit from good timing." That's insulting. The task she faces is Sisyphean, if you take the view that Sisyphus even enjoyed his task; I couldn't manage a smile if I knew I was the predicted winner. I applaud her for having the nerve to run in these recessionary times which, unlike past recessions, is structural in nature. Even the sclerotic Europeans understand this and are taking painful measures to resolve it. If Haley enjoys success it will be all hers, and not because she sat back, sipped mint juleps, and watched the hounds run (I was at a steeplechase in Tryon a few years ago and watched a female jockey start the race way in the back of the all-male pack and yet she was first across the finish line - I will enjoy watching Nikki Haley succeed as much as I enjoyed that race). When I see Haley I see a Thatcher or a Merkel. Pay attention to her and you will be impressed.

People will eventually come to see there's no difference between one gang of thieves and warmongers and the other. It's time to start again, but maybe not as a unified out-of-control decaying bankrupt Empire. More economic pain will be the stimulus, but that's inevitable - neither party has the slightest idea or intention of doing anything that their Wall Street masters don't want, and that means poverty for about 85% of Americans.
Let us cultivate our gardens.

Chicago was very, very quiet today. Empty commuter trains, silent phones. I was getting worried until I remembered: tomorrow is Election Day. Which means, in Chicago, that today is Election Day.

This blue state might prove hard to turn red.
